  "description": "Equity Specialist Hospital is a modern medical facility in Lagos, Nigeria, committed to providing world-class, patient-centered care. Backed by Equity Health Group, the hospital offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic services across key specialties, using cutting-edge medical technology. Its mission is to make high-quality healthcare accessible locally while reducing medical tourism.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Finance Manager will oversee and manage all financial aspects of the hospital&rsquo;s operations, ensuring accuracy, accountability, and compliance with financial regulations.
	This includes preparing and analyzing financial reports, managing budgets, overseeing billing and collections, and ensuring timely balancing and reconciliation of HMO claims
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting strategic decision-making to drive financial sustainability and growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily financial operations including budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management.
	Ensure accurate and timely preparation of financial statements, reports, and records.
	Manage and reconcile HMO claims and payments to ensure accuracy and completeness.
	Monitor outstanding receivables and follow up on payments from patients, HMOs, and corporate clients.
	Supervise the billing and collections team to ensure proper documentation and compliance with hospital policies.
	Develop and implement internal control systems to safeguard hospital assets.
	Conduct financial analysis to support decision-making and identify cost-saving opportunities.
	Oversee payroll administration, statutory deductions, and remittances.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations, accounting standards, and other financial laws.
	Liaise with external auditors, tax consultants, and regulatory agencies.
	Support management with financial insights for operational and strategic planning.
	Prepare and present periodic financial performance reports to management.
	Guide, train, and supervise finance team members to ensure efficiency and accuracy.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	5 - 7 years of progressive finance/accounting experience, preferably in a healthcare or hospital environment.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, or equivalent) is required.
	Strong knowledge of HMO billing and claims reconciliation.
	Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel.
	In-depth understanding of Nigerian tax laws and financial regulations.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Financial planning and reporting.
	HMO claims management and reconciliation.
	Budgeting and cost control.
	Tax and regulatory compliance.
	Leadership and team management.
	Analytical thinking and problem solving.
	Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills.


Salary
N350,000 - N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
